summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, discussing the lack of current criminal exposure for an unnamed individual based on her interactions with Epstein. The email references a prior phone conversation and attorney proffer, and suggests further discussions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the SDNY investigation; the email discusses an individual's interactions with him.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, communicating with Jeffrey Epstein's attorney about the status of an investigation and an individual's potential criminal exposure.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is part of the SDNY team investigating Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email regarding SDNY investigation
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Jeffrey Epstein's attorney to memorialize a phone conversation, stating there is currently no reason to believe an unnamed individual has criminal exposure related to interactions with Epstein.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was active as of December 2019.
Prosecutors were assessing the criminal exposure of individuals based on their interactions with Epstein.
The communication involves an attorney proffer regarding an individual's interactions with Epstein.
The email suggests the statute of limitations may bar prosecution for non-federal offenses.
The identity of the individual being discussed is redacted or omitted from the provided text.
